apiValue.shortdesc: Landscape - for applications that need to serve ads in landscape orientation.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Landscape - for applications that need to serve ads in landscape orientation.

apiValue.shortdesc: Portrait Landscape - for applications that need to serve ads in either portrait or landscape

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Portrait Landscape - for applications that need to serve ads in either portrait or landscape

apiValue.shortdesc: Portrait - for applications that need to serve ads in portrait orientation.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Portrait - for applications that need to serve ads in portrait orientation.

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched when the interstitial is removed from the screen.

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched when the interstitial is removed from the screen. If you had previously stopped sound or paused in response to IAdEvent.INTERSTITIAL_SHOWN, you may resume in response to this event.

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched when an interstitial ad appears on screen.

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched when an interstitial ad appears on screen. You may wish to pause sounds etc when this happens

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched when the user finishes interacting with an interstitial ad.

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched when the user finishes interacting with an interstitial ad.

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched when the user begins an interaction with the interstitial ad.

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched when the user begins an interaction with the interstitial ad. Games should consider pausing sounds, etc.

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched when an interstitial ad has failed to load.

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched when an interstitial ad has failed to load.

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched when a banner ad has failed to load.

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched when a banner ad has failed to load. The extension will handle visibility and retrying automatically, so you do not need to call any special actions in most cases for this event.

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched when an Interstitial Ad Has been unloaded from memory.

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched when an Interstitial Ad Has been unloaded from memory.

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched when an interstitial ad has loaded.

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched when an interstitial ad has loaded. If loadInterstitial was called with autoShow set to true, the ad will be displayed automatically now. Otherwise, use showPendingInterstitial to display the ad.

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched when the user has finished interacting with a banner Ad.

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched when the user has finished interacting with a banner Ad. If you had previously stopped sound or paused in response to BANNER_ACTION_BEGIN, you may resume when you receive this event.

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched when the user began interacting with a banner ad; either leaving your app to go to the app store (willLeaveApplication will be true), or is now viewing a fullscreen take over ad on to of your ad (willLeaveApplication false.) If willLeaveApplication is false, you should stop music and pause until you receive IAdEvent.BANNER_ACTION_FINISHED.

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched when the user began interacting with a banner ad; either leaving your app to go to the app store (willLeaveApplication will be true), or is now viewing a fullscreen take over ad on to of your ad (willLeaveApplication false.) If willLeaveApplication is false, you should stop music and pause until you receive IAdEvent.BANNER_ACTION_FINISHED.

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Disapatched when a Banner Ad Has Loaded.

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Disapatched when a Banner Ad Has Loaded. The ad is automatically displayed.

apiConstructor.shortdesc: Do not call this directly; use IAd.create() to initialize or IAd.iAd to get current instance.

apiConstructorDetail.apiDesc: Do not call this directly; use IAd.create() to initialize or IAd.iAd to get current instance.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Cancels the current user interaction with the ad.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Cancels the current user interaction with the ad. If the user has clicked on a banner and is interacting with a fullscreen pop up, it will be cancelled by this call.
You should avoid using this unless absolutely necessary, as it can negatively affect the value and number of ads Apple will provide your application.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Cancels the current user interaction with the interstitial ad.

apiException.apiDesc: if interstitials are not available on this platform.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Cancels the current user interaction with the interstitial ad. If the user is viewing an interstitial ad, it will be cancelled by this call.
You should avoid using this unless absolutely necessary, as it can negatively affect the value and number of ads Apple will provide your application.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Starts up the iAd banner system, aligned either top or bottom, and with an optional offset value.

apiParam.apiDesc: either IAdBannerAlignment.TOP or IAdBannerAlignment.BOTTOM - whether you want ads to show top or bottom of the screen.

IAdContentSize.PORTRAIT, IAdContentSize.LANDSCAPE, or IAdContentSize.PORTRAIT_AND_LANDSCAPE. This tells iAd the possible orientations you'd like ads to display in, and it will load only ads from the server that are available in these orientations. Note that this applies to the pop up ads themselves, and not the physical banner. The banner will always be fit properly on to your phone or tablet's screen.
optional offset of the banner relative to its alignment property. You can use this if you need the shift the ad slightly up or down.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Starts up the iAd banner system, aligned either top or bottom, and with an optional offset value.
Apple serves ads, and refreshes with new ads, on an automatic timer. Apple also requires that the ad area be hidden when no ad is available to display. IAd extension manages all this behavior for you automatically.
When you first call createBannerAd, iAd will start requesting ads. When an ad becomes available, it will be displayed on the screen, and you will receive the IAdEvent.BANNER_AD_LOADED when one is about to be displayed, or IAdErrorEvent.BANNER_AD_FAILED when the loading has failed. You may receive these events multiple times over the lifecycle of your application, because iAd automatically continues to try loading new ads.
In the event of a failed ad load (IAdErrorEvent.BANNER_AD_FAILED) the extension will automatically hide the ad banner area, and show it again on the next successful ad load from Apple- which will also happen automatically. You do not need to do anything special other than set up listeners for these events. You should NOT destroy the ad in these events, unless you wish to discontinue its use for a prolonged period or permanently. You also do NOT need to reset the visibility in these events, unless you wish to temporarily hide the ad area during a menu transition or other change in your application.
When the user clicks on an ad, you will receive the IAdEvent.BANNER_ACTION_BEGIN event. At this time, the user will either be taken out of your application to view the app store (and the event's willLeaveApplication property will be true), or they will be presented with a fullscreen advertisement to interact with, and willLeaveApplication will be false. In the latter case, you should stop the sound in your application until the IAdEvent.BANNER_ACTION_FINISHED event is fired.

apiException.apiDesc: if IAd has already been initialized.

apiReturn.apiDesc: initialized instance of IAd extension interface.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Initializes the IAd Extension. You should check IAd.isSupported first to ensure the platform is iOS. IAd is a Singleton and you may have only one instance. After creation, you may access the instance through the static property IAd.iAd .

apiOperation.shortdesc: Destroys the active banner ad player.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Destroys the active banner ad player. You should NOT call this in response to an IAdErrorEvent, unless you want ads to stop displaying permanently. (The extension automatically tries again later for the next working ad and displays it in these cases.)
You may call destroyBannerAd() if you do not need to show ads again ever in this application, or for a long time - in those cases, it is preferable to setVisibility(false), because it will prevent your ad inventory from being spent where the user won't be able to see it.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Checks if iAd is capable of running on the current device.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if the running device is capable of displaying iAds.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Checks if iAd is capable of running on the current device. Requires iOS 4.2+. Call this after IAd.create() and before making any other calls.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Checks if IAd Interstitial ads are available on the running device.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if the current device supports iAd Interstitials

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Checks if IAd Interstitial ads are available on the running device. Interstitials require at least iOS 4.3 to run on iPad, and at least iOS 7.0 to run on an iPhone or iPod Touch. If your device is an iPhone or iPod Touch running an iOS version under 7.0, you will not be able to use Interstitial ads (banners will still work.)

apiOperation.shortdesc: Checks if an interstitial that was preloaded with a call to loadInterstitial(false) is loaded and ready for display via showPendingInterstitial().

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if an interstitial is preloaded and ready for display

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Checks if an interstitial that was preloaded with a call to loadInterstitial(false) is loaded and ready for display via showPendingInterstitial().

apiOperation.shortdesc: Checks if the current platform supports IAd.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if IAd is supported; false otherwise.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Checks if the current platform supports IAd. Note that this only determines whether the app is running under iOS (as opposed to Android, Windows, etc.)
Use this call before initializing IAd in order to confirm that you are on iOS. (So that you can avoid initializing IAd on an unsupported platform when building a multi-platform app.)

apiException.apiDesc: if attempting to preload a new interstitial when the previous interstitial is not yet cleared

apiParam.apiDesc: optional. If set to false, the ad will be preloaded but not immediately displayed

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Loads an interstitial, fullscreen advertisement. These are higher value ads that take up the whole screen until the user has dismissed them.
By default, the interstitial will be displayed as soon as it's loaded. Optionally, you can opt to preload the interstitial by setting the autoShow parameter to false, then display it at a later time using showPendingInterstitial(). When doing so, you should wait for the IAdEvent.INTERSTITIAL_AD_LOADED callback, and check isInterstitialReady() before calling showPendingInterstitial().
You cannot pre-load a new interstitial when the previous interstitial is still pending. Wait for the IAdErrorEvent.INTERSTITIAL_AD_FAILED or IAdEvent.INTERSTITIAL_DISMISSED events before preloading a new interstitial.
Interstitial ads are only availble on iPads running iOS 4.3+ and iPhones or iPod Touches running iOS 7.0+. You should use the function IAd.iAd.isInterstitialAvailable() first, to determine if this call will work and avoid an error.
If the interstitial fails to load, you will receive the IAdErrorEvent.INTERSTITIAL_AD_FAILED event. In this case you should continue on with your application as no interstitial ads are available at this time.
When the ad is shown on the screen, IAdEvent.INTERSTITIAL_SHOWN will be dispatched. At this point you should stop the sound in your application and consider pausing any important user actions.
When the ad has been closed, you will receive the IAdEvent.INTERSTITIAL_DISMISSED event; at this juncture, you may wish to resume paused audio or other changes made at IAdEvent.INTERSTITIAL_SHOWN.
When an interstitial has been removed from memory, you will receive the IAdEvent.INTERSTITIAL_AD_UNLOADED event.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Sets the requested visibility of banner ads.

apiParam.apiDesc: whether you want the ad to be visible, or invisible
whether you want the ad to show or hide with a quick animated slide on or off the screen.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Sets the requested visibility of banner ads.
Note that you do NOT need to call this in response to IAdEvent.BANNER_AD_LOADED or IAdEvent.BANNER_AD_FAILED; the extension automatically manages ad visibility in these cases.
You can use this function to temporarily hide the ad when switching to a menu or screen which does not need an ad, then show it again when the user returns later.
If you wish for the ad to be removed for a long period of time, or permanently, you should use IAd.iAd.destroyBannerAd() - this will prevent ad inventory from being wasted on an invisible ad.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Presents an interstitial ad that was previously loaded via loadInterstitial(false).

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Presents an interstitial ad that was previously loaded via loadInterstitial(false). You should check isInterstitialReady() first to ensure that loading has completed.

apiValue.shortdesc: The current instance of the IAd singelton.

apiException.apiDesc: if IAd.create() was not called before first accessing this property.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The current instance of the IAd singelton. You must call IAd.create() before this property is available.
